plain_english_explanation: Ensure that only authorized individuals can access the system by managing and controlling the use of authenticators.
example_implementation: This script implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) to enhance security and ensure that only authorized users can access the system.
non_technical_guidance:
This plan to comply with IA-5 (Authenticator Management), organizations should implement the following non-technical measures:

1. Develop and enforce a policy that outlines the management of system authenticators, including passwords, tokens, smart cards, etc.
2. Ensure that authenticators are assigned to individuals based on their roles and responsibilities.
3. Implement procedures for the secure distribution, storage, and destruction of authenticators.
4. Regularly review and update access controls for authenticators to ensure only authorized individuals have access.
5. Monitor and audit the use of authenticators to detect any unauthorized access or misuse.
6. Provide training to employees on the proper use and management of authenticators to prevent security incidents.
7. Conduct periodic assessments and reviews of the authenticator management processes to identify and address any vulnerabilities or weaknesses.

enhancements.title: In-person or Trusted External Party Registration
Automated Support for Password Strength Determination
Change Authenticators Prior to Delivery
enhancements.official_text: Require developers and installers of system components to provide unique authenticators or change default authenticators prior to delivery and installation.

enhancements.title: Protection of Authenticators
enhancements.official_text: Protect authenticators commensurate with the security category of the information to which use of the authenticator permits access.

enhancements.title: No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators
enhancements.official_text: Ensure that unencrypted static authenticators are not embedded in applications or other forms of static storage.

enhancements.title: Multiple System Accounts
enhancements.official_text: Implement {{ insert: param, ia-05.08_odp }} to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having accounts on multiple systems.

enhancements.title: Federated Credential Management
enhancements.official_text: Use the following external organizations to federate credentials: {{ insert: param, ia-05.09_odp }}.

enhancements.title: Dynamic Credential Binding
enhancements.official_text: Bind identities and authenticators dynamically using the following rules: {{ insert: param, ia-05.10_odp }}.

enhancements.title: Biometric Authentication Performance
enhancements.official_text: For biometric-based authentication, employ mechanisms that satisfy the following biometric quality requirements {{ insert: param, ia-05.12_odp }}.

enhancements.title: Expiration of Cached Authenticators
enhancements.official_text: Prohibit the use of cached authenticators after {{ insert: param, ia-05.13_odp }}.

enhancements.title: Managing Content of PKI Trust Stores
enhancements.official_text: For PKI-based authentication, employ an organization-wide methodology for managing the content of PKI trust stores installed across all platforms, including networks, operating systems, browsers, and applications.

enhancements.title: GSA-approved Products and Services
enhancements.official_text: Use only General Services Administration-approved products and services for identity, credential, and access management.

enhancements.title: In-person or Trusted External Party Authenticator Issuance
enhancements.official_text: Require that the issuance of {{ insert: param, ia-05.16_odp.01 }} be conducted {{ insert: param, ia-05.16_odp.02 }} before {{ insert: param, ia-05.16_odp.03 }} with authorization by {{ insert: param, ia-05.16_odp.04 }}.

enhancements.title: Presentation Attack Detection for Biometric Authenticators
enhancements.official_text: Employ presentation attack detection mechanisms for biometric-based authentication.
